Last month, the Bill of Rights Institute and Utah Valley Universitys Center for Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University partnered to host a civics workshop for educators at Southern Utah University. The full-day training introduced BRIs new elementary curriculum, BRI Jr., and provided strategies for teaching primary sources on the Articles of Confederation and the Bill of Rights. Teachers praised the session as one of the best theyve attended, noting the wealth of ready-to-use resources and classroom applications. Read more about the workshop on our blog, here  https://lnkd.in/eK8B34b3 Learn more about upcoming BRI events and professional development opportunities, visit  https://lnkd.in/eKkSxNzF.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI

February is Black History Montha time to reflect on the profound contributions, achievements, and struggles of Black Americans throughout US history. At the Bill of Rights Institute, we honor the voices and stories that have shaped our nation's journey toward equality and justice. Through resources like primary source documents, videos, and lesson plans, we provide educators and students with tools to explore the legacy of civil rights, activism, and leadership in America. Discover our playlist to bring Black History Month into your classroom  https://lnkd.in/efqR-pHu

Did you know you can use a Donor Advised Fund (DAF) to support civic and history education? A DAF is a flexible, tax-advantaged way to give back, allowing you to make charitable contributions and recommend grants over time. By directing your DAF to the Bill of Rights Institute, you can help empower students and educators with free resources to explore the founding principles of our nation. Make an impact today!
